what_they_look_like: Tiny red, yellow, or translucent dots; fine webbing on leaves.
identification: Leaves speckled or stippled; webbing between stems; thrives in dry air.
prevention: Increase humidity; avoid underwatering; shower plants regularly.
treatment: Spray with neem oil or insecticidal soap weekly; wipe leaves; use miticide if severe.

what_they_look_like: White cottony clusters on leaves, stems, nodes.
identification: Sticky honeydew on leaves; rapid spread in warm indoor spaces.
prevention: Inspect new plants; isolate affected ones; avoid overfertilizing.
treatment: Q-tip dipped in alcohol to remove; neem oil spray every 7 days; systemic insecticide for heavy cases.
